intro: Dontospermum lanuginosum, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its distinctive succulent foliage and vibrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant features fleshy, hairy leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and dry landscapes.
